snippet: The hackers had deployed a malware attack to hold the computer system of Hollywood Presbyterian Medical Center hostage and demanded the ransom.
abstract: Cyberhackers, in shift, are moving away from small users to larger entities, like hospitals, where they are taking control of critical computer systems through malware and demanding ransoms for their release; Hollywood Presbyterian Medical Center in Los Angeles, which paid $17,000 ransom to release hacked and locked computers, is not first victim of its type, but is among first to make incident public.

byline.original: By STACY COWLEY and LIAM STACK

lead_paragraph: The hackers had deployed a malware attack to hold the computer system of Hollywood Presbyterian Medical Center hostage and demanded the ransom.

headline.main: Los Angeles Hospital Pays Hackers $17,000 After Attack
headline.print_headline: A Web Crime on the Rise:  Hackers Lock Out Users and Demand a Ransom
